Description: A circular jar-lid of pale grey-green marl ware pottery, with a convex top. The underside has a projecting rim intended to fit the neck of a vessel, with a flat flange all round the perimeter. Part of the rim is broken. The concave centre of the underside is stained by a reddish incrustation.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Findspot 52, south-eastern quarter of the Saite enclosure (so-called "Camp"), area of ironsmith's workshops.
Curator's comments: The Findspot number 52 is scratched into the underside of the lid.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 64, 66 § 61, pl. xxxvi, 91) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.109, p.197, pl.39)
